00031 struct os {
00032   typedef enum type {
00033     win_2k          = 0,
00034     win_2k_sp4      = 1000,
00035     win_xp          = 2000,
00036     win_xp_sp2      = 3000,
00037     win_vista       = 4000
00038   };
00039 };

00046 struct property_access {
00047     typedef enum type {
00048         r = 1,  // read
00049         w = 2,  // write
00050         rw = 3  // read-write
00051     };
00052 };
00053 
00054 namespace property_base {
00055     template<class type> struct property_write ;

00058 namespace property_operators {
00059     template<class self_type, class property_type> struct string {
00060         // +=
00061         property_type operator+=(const property_type & val) {
00062             self_type & self = static_cast<self_type&>(*this);
00063             property_type new_val = self.get() + val;
00064             self.set( new_val);
00065             return new_val;
00066         }
00067     };
00068 
00069     template<class self_type, class property_type> struct flag {
00070         // |=, &=
00071         property_type operator|=(const property_type & val) {
00072             self_type & self = static_cast<self_type&>(*this);
00073             property_type new_val = self.get() | val;
00074             self.set( new_val);
00075             return new_val;
00076         }
00077         property_type operator&=(const property_type & val) {
00078             self_type & self = static_cast<self_type&>(*this);
00079             property_type new_val = self.get() & val;
00080             self.set( new_val);
00081             return new_val;
00082         }
00083     };
00084 
00085     template<class self_type, class property_type> struct number {
00086         // +=, -=, *=, /=
00087         // ++, --
00088 
00089         property_type operator+=(const property_type & val) {
00090             self_type & self = static_cast<self_type&>(*this);
00091             property_type new_val = self.get() + val;
00092             self.set( new_val);
00093             return new_val;
00094         }
00095         property_type operator-=(const property_type & val) {
00096             self_type & self = static_cast<self_type&>(*this);
00097             property_type new_val = self.get() - val;
00098             self.set( new_val);
00099             return new_val;
00100         }
00101         property_type operator*=(const property_type & val) {
00102             self_type & self = static_cast<self_type&>(*this);
00103             property_type new_val = self.get() * val;
00104             self.set( new_val);
00105             return new_val;
00106         }
00107         property_type operator/=(const property_type & val) {
00108             self_type & self = static_cast<self_type&>(*this);
00109             property_type new_val = self.get() / val;
00110             self.set( new_val);
00111             return new_val;
00112         }
00113 
00114         self_type & operator++() {
00115             self_type & self = static_cast<self_type&>(*this);
00116             property_type new_val = self.get() + 1;
00117             self.set( new_val);
00118             return self;
00119         }
00120         property_type operator++(int) {
00121             self_type & self = static_cast<self_type&>(*this);
00122             property_type old_val = self.get() ;
00123             self.set( old_val + 1);
00124             return old_val;
00125         }
00126 
00127         self_type & operator--() {
00128             self_type & self = static_cast<self_type&>(*this);
00129             property_type new_val = self.get() - 1;
00130             self.set( new_val);
00131             return self;
00132         }
00133         property_type operator--(int) {
00134             self_type & self = static_cast<self_type&>(*this);
00135             property_type old_val = self.get() ;
00136             self.set( old_val - 1);
00137             return old_val;
00138         }
00139 
00140         // FIXME perhaps in the future I will allow only | and & for flags
00141         // |=, &=
00142         property_type operator|=(const property_type & val) {
00143             self_type & self = static_cast<self_type&>(*this);
00144             property_type new_val = self.get() | val;
00145             self.set( new_val);
00146             return new_val;
00147         }
00148         property_type operator&=(const property_type & val) {
00149             self_type & self = static_cast<self_type&>(*this);
00150             property_type new_val = self.get() & val;
00151             self.set( new_val);
00152             return new_val;
00153         }
00154     };
00155 
00156     template<class type, class self_type> struct operator_base {};
00157     template<class self_type> struct operator_base<types::int64,self_type> 
00158         : number < self_type, types::int64 > {};
00159     template<class self_type> struct operator_base<int,self_type> 
00160         : number < self_type, int > {};
00161     template<class self_type> struct operator_base<egui::string,self_type> 
00162         : string< self_type, egui::string > {};
00163 }

00165 namespace property_base {

00167     template<class type> struct getter_ptr {
00168         getter_ptr(const type & val) : val(val) {}
00169 
00170         const type *operator->() const { return &val; }
00171     private:
00172         type val;
00173     };
00174 
00175     template<class type> struct property_read ;
00176     template<class type> inline void do_set_getter(property_read<type> & val, boost::function0<type> f ) ; 
00177 
00178     template<class type> struct property_read {
00179         operator type() const { return get(); }
00180         type get() const { return getter(); }
00181 
00182         // just in case you want to call a const method on the result
00183         getter_ptr<type> operator->() const { return getter(); }
00184     private:
00185         template<class other_type> friend inline void do_set_getter(property_read<other_type> &, boost::function0<other_type> f );
00186         boost::function0< type  > getter;
00187     };
00188     template<class type> inline void do_set_getter(property_read<type> & val, boost::function0<type> f ) {
00189         val.getter = f;
00190     }
00191

00194     template<class type> struct property_write ;
00195     template<class type> inline void do_set_setter(property_write<type> & val, boost::function1<void, const type&> f ) ; 
00196 
00197     // here, care about operators!
00198     template<class type> struct property_write {
00199         void set(const type& val) {
00200             setter(val);
00201         }
00202         void operator=(const type & val) {
00203             setter(val);
00204             return val;
00205         }
00206     private:
00207         template<class other_type> friend inline void do_set_setter(property_write<other_type> & val, boost::function1<void, const other_type&> f ) ; 
00208         boost::function1< void, const type& > setter;
00209     };
00210     template<class type> inline void do_set_setter(property_write<type> & val, boost::function1<void, const type&> f ) {
00211         val.setter = f;
00212     }

00219     template<class type, class param, int have_read, int have_write> struct property_one_arg ;
00220 
00221     template<class type, class param, int have_read, int have_write> struct property_one_arg_holder {
00222         typedef property_one_arg<type,param,have_read,have_write> property_type;
00223         property_one_arg_holder(property_type * self, const param& arg) : self(self), arg(arg) {}
00224 
00225         operator type() const {
00226             // FIXME - see if this affects compile time
00227             // BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT(have_read); 
00228             return self->getter(arg);
00229         }
00230 
00231         const type& operator=(const type & val) {
00232             // FIXME - see if this affects compile time
00233             // BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT(have_write); 
00234             self->setter(arg, val);
00235             return val;
00236         }
00237     private:
00238         property_type* self;
00239         param arg;
00240     };
00241

00245   //      property_one_arg<type,param,have_read,have_write> & val, boost::function1<type,param> f ) ;
00246 //    template<class type, class param, int have_read, int have_write, class p5, class p6> inline void do_set_setter(
00247   //      property_one_arg<type,param,have_read,have_write> & val, boost::function2<void,p5,p6 > f ) ;
00248 
00249     template<class type, class param, int have_read, int have_write> struct property_one_arg {
00250         typedef type value_type;
00251         const property_one_arg_holder<type,param,have_read,have_write> operator()(const param & arg) const { 
00252             return property_one_arg_holder<type,param,have_read,have_write>( const_cast<property_one_arg*>(this) ,arg);
00253         }
00254         property_one_arg_holder<type,param,have_read,have_write> operator()(const param & arg) { 
00255             return property_one_arg_holder<type,param,have_read,have_write>(this,arg);
00256         }
00257     private:
00258 //        template<class p1,class p2, int p3, int p4> friend inline void do_set_getter(
00259   //          property_one_arg<p1,p2,p3,p4> & val, boost::function1<p1,p2> f ) ;
00260        
00261 //        template<class p1,class p2, int p3, int p4, class p5, class p6> friend inline void do_set_setter(
00262   //          property_one_arg<p1,p2,p3,p4> & val, boost::function2<void,p5,p6 > f ) ;
00263     public:
00264         boost::function1< type , param > getter;
00265         boost::function2< void, const param&, const type& > setter;
00266     };
00267 
00268     template<class type, class param, int have_read, int have_write> inline void do_set_getter(
00269             property_one_arg<type,param,have_read,have_write> & val, boost::function1<type,param> f ) {
00270         val.getter = f;
00271     }
00272     template<class type, class param, int have_read, int have_write,class p5, class p6> inline void do_set_setter(
00273             property_one_arg<type,param,have_read,have_write> & val, boost::function2<void,p5,p6 > f ) {
00274         val.setter = f;
00275     }

00281     template<os::type property_os, class base> struct only_for_os {};
00282 
00283 #if EGUI_OS >= 4000
00284     template<class base> struct only_for_os<os::win_vista, base> : base {};
00285 #endif
00286 
00287 #if EGUI_OS >= 3000
00288     template<class base> struct only_for_os<os::win_xp_sp2, base> : base {};
00289 #endif
00290 
00291 #if EGUI_OS >= 2000
00292     template<class base> struct only_for_os<os::win_xp, base> : base {};
00293 #endif
00294 
00295 #if EGUI_OS >= 1000
00296     template<class base> struct only_for_os<os::win_2k_sp4, base> : base {};
00297 #endif
00298 
00299 #if EGUI_OS >= 0
00300     template<class base> struct only_for_os<os::win_2k, base> : base {};
00301 #endif

00310 struct property
00311 {
00312     template<class type, class base_type = void_, os::type property_os = os::win_2k > struct rw 
00313         // we derive from base_type first, so that code-completion works (it's easy for the compiler to parse the base_type class)
00314         : base_type
00315         , property_base::only_for_os< property_os, property_base::property_read<type> >
00316         , property_base::only_for_os< property_os, property_base::property_write<type> >
00317         , property_operators::operator_base< type, rw<type,base_type,property_os> >
00318     {
00319         const type & operator=(const type & val) {
00320             property_base::property_write<type>::set(val);
00321             return val;
00322         }
00323     };
00324 
00325     template<class type, class base_type = void_, os::type property_os = os::win_2k > struct r 
00326         : base_type
00327         , property_base::only_for_os< property_os, property_base::property_read<type> > 
00328     {};
00329 
00330     template<class type, class base_type = void_, os::type property_os = os::win_2k > struct w
00331         : base_type
00332         , property_base::only_for_os< property_os, property_base::property_write<type> >
00333     {
00334         const type & operator=(const type & val) {
00335             property_base::property_write<type>::set(val);
00336             return val;
00337         }
00338     };
00339 };
00340 
00344 struct property_one_arg
00345 {
00346     template<class type, class param, class base_type = void_, os::type property_os = os::win_2k > struct rw 
00347         : base_type
00348         , property_base::only_for_os< property_os, property_base::property_one_arg<type, param, 1, 1> >
00349     {};
00350 
00351     template<class type, class param, class base_type = void_, os::type property_os = os::win_2k > struct r 
00352         : base_type
00353         , property_base::only_for_os< property_os, property_base::property_one_arg<type, param, 1, 0> >
00354     {};
00355 
00356     template<class type, class param, class base_type = void_, os::type property_os = os::win_2k > struct w
00357         : base_type
00358         , property_base::only_for_os< property_os, property_base::property_one_arg<type, param, 0, 1> >
00359     {};
00360 };
